Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a find.”
Reviews.Author: VinRouge79
Reviews.Content: You only stay in your room to sleep whilst in Paris to much to do and see:-) Fab location for Paris, 2 mns walk to CDG metro/rer/airport bus/Champs Elysees bliss. Easy walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Bateaux Mouche at the Seine. For Paris rates its a gem, breakfast is continental no probs rooms are clean if basic staff very helpful and friendly rates are great for the location, go to Marriott or Charles V etc if you want to pay for 5* accomodation in the same area? Lift is quaint two persons at a time! luggage optional! We had a room with a small balcony with double doors opening onto the street below very atmospheric. Will be back so much still discover may need a # of vists to see them all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FHN21
Reviews.Content: Just 2 minutes walk from the airport bus stop and 3 minutes walk to the top of Champs Élysées, this hotel is just perfect for a short stay in Paris. We stayed only one night and found the staff friendly, the room good enough. Breakfast was simple, but adequate. The price of our room was only 80euros and that is quite extraordinary at such a location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mir929
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Phenix for five nights during a business trip. The hotel was recommended by the hosts because of the location - near the Arc and the Champs. The rooms are not very big but were enough for one person. Some of the other guests complained about the noise from the street but for me it was OK. The bathroom was really small but clean. The staff were friendly, answered all my questions. Breakfast was basic but enough. As a whole I would recommend it to people who are on a budget. The truth is, I only slept there. After all you don't go to Paris to stay in ahotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not even go near the Phenix”
Reviews.Author: FranceSpecialist
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris at least once a year, as I am a travel consultant and tourism instructor, and French is my native language. I had Emailed my credit card info to the manager months ago, and had received a written confirmation online, signed by "the manager" ,for 3 nights. My husband and I were returning from a 10-day whirlwind drive through Switzerland and France, and arrived at the hotel after returning our rental car, exhausted and loaded with luggage at 9 pm. The night man told us we had no reservation, refused to call the manager at home, finally did so to be told my reservation and credit card info were never received (although I was brandishing print-outs of their confirmation in my hand), etc. I had to call the police, who came immediately, but told me that although what the hotel did was absolutely dishonest and unprofessional, there was no police case as there was no crime committed (They had not charged my card). At that point the night attendant suddenly found out that a room might be available (for one night) at midnight because "a client might be leaving" but since they were booked for the next days, they would take pity on us and give us shelter (not free of course) for that night. To make a long story short, my husband and I walked around in the neighborhood another half hour (it was almost midnite by then), found another hotel nearby, and stayed there 4 nights at a higher rate. There are several small but clean hotels on the little streets between Avenue Carnot and Avenue MacMahon (an area which I prefer because of its proximity to the Air France Airport bus terminal at Etoile. Don't even try to reserve lodging at the Phenix, because they do not honor even written reservations, and you may well end up like us Sleepless and Roomless in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Hotel Phenix”
Reviews.Author: SanJosean
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us who stayed at the Phenix Hotel at the recommendation of a co-worker who stayed there several years ago. We should have checked with Trip Advisor to see other recommendations. We had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor. The lobby appeared very clean and gave no clue of the condition of our rooms. We knew this to be a budget hotel and didn't expect much. Safety and cleanliness was our main objective. The hotel is in a safe area, but cleanliness was just as important to us, and we were sorely disappointed. Both rooms were very substandard to say the least. The old furniture didn't bother us. Our disappointment was from the condition of the rooms. The hallway and the rooms stenched (carpet probably does not get cleaned regularly), shower curtains were old and mildewed with black spots all over. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I would rather pay more to have a clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet for the money”
Reviews.Author: NevadaRoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several years ago and I'm glad it is still getting good reviews. It is a bare bones hotel but clean andfriendly. Great location near the Arch de Triumph and just off the Champs'. It can't be beat for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tiquo
Reviews.Content: A excellent experience in Paris. The hotel has a great location, friendly staff, very clean rooms, and good prices. The staff group were atenciously and help us to know better the city. I'm sure that a new visit in Paris we will come back there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Singles & Couples on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: Napa_Old_World_Inn
Reviews.Content: A perfect choice for a traveler who wants a clean bed, private bath, and a great location. Bare bones, with a great price. I typically paid around $50-60 per night a few years back (haven't been since 2003). I'm posting this review since I only see one other for this hotel. Have stayed here mulitple times over the past 10 years. Rooms all have a super tiny private bath (dinky dinky!), with a charming elevator that holds 2 French people, or one American (it's about 24" x 24"). Squishing my bags in with me was a hoot. :) First stayed here based on positive reviews read on other sites, and kept coming back. This is not a 5 star hotel. It's a 2 star, with a great price for travelers on a budget. Staff is very friendly, and there is a complimentary coffee w/bread and jam each morning. This may not sound like much, but remember-- this is Paris. Excellent quality food. I took the Air France bus from the airport (it drops you off 3 blocks from the hotel-- and easy walk if you have wheeled luggage). So a big savings compared to taxis or shuttles. I fell in love w/this location b/c I walked all over Paris each day. It's 3 blocks from the Arch de Triumphe (that's where the bus lets you off, a cool intro for a 1st timer!). The Arch is at the start of the Champs Elysees, which is a long, but incredibly beautiful boulevard walk to the Louvre and Toullieries gardens. I never tired of walking (had great walking shoes-- best money I spent on the entire trip). If you love walking, it was just so cool to walk the Champs Elysees each day, and then veer off to the Opera House, the Musée d' Orsay, the Isle St Louis . . . I could go on and on. Some travelers prefer locations with a view of the Eiffel Tower. For me, this was not important. I took the subway to see both this and Musée Marmottan (great collection of Monets' work, including Impression Sunrise). Having a place so centrally located was incredible (I walked virtually everywhere). I truly felt more a part of the city for it. Haven't been to Paris since I started innkeeping (in late 2003), so you'll want to check other travel sites to make sure this hotel is still run by the same friendly folks. When I stayed, I spent about $55 per night. I'm guessing it will be about double that now, given what's happened to the dollar. Still, it was a bargain. And I'll be back!

HotelInfo.Name: Phenix Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5 rue General Lanrezac, 75017 Paris, France
